title: Bug 3666: Code Completion Hungry Code Assist (1GDRYW5)
description: Bug 3666: Code Completion Hungry Code Assist (1GDRYW5) jkca (5/15/2001 11:04:56 AM) jresdk 106 Under certain circumstances, code assist consumes excessive code. Consider the enclosed class. As a programmer, I need to add a parameter to the baz call in bar to correct the program. Steps: 1. UI can decide whether it wants to use the code assist end position (until the end of the current identifier) or the cursor location it used to start with, to control the amount of source to replace. Removing the code assist option.
OB: Code assist consumes excessive code, affecting the program behavior.
EB: Code assist should provide accurate suggestions without consuming excessive code. The program should behave correctly after adding a parameter to the baz call in bar.
SR:
1. Change the baz call to baz(x.x.foo())
2. Place the cursor after the first "x."
3. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up code assist
4. Type "f" to filter the list
5. Select "foo()"
